meanings.definition: To eat or drink quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: I saw the hungry dog snarf down its food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She always snarfs her snacks when she's in a rush.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon tried to snarf the cookies from the jar but got caught in the act.
meanings.sent4: The kids snarfed up all the candy at the party before anyone else could get some.
meanings.sent5: The competitive eater managed to snarf down 20 hot dogs in just a few minutes.

meanings.definition: To steal or take something quickly and slyly.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky thief tried to snarf the jewels from the museum.
meanings.sent2: He would often snarf his sister's toys when she wasn't looking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to snarf the fish from the aquarium without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket was able to snarf the wallet from the distracted tourist.
meanings.sent5: The spy was able to snarf the secret documents without raising any suspicion.

meanings.definition: A person who eats or drinks quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: My brother is a real snarf when it comes to pizza.
meanings.sent2: The movie character was portrayed as a snarf who couldn't resist a buffet.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon depicted the snarf as a comical character always with a full mouth.
meanings.sent4: The party had a designated snarf who finished all the snacks in record time.
meanings.sent5: The competitive eating contest attracted many snarfs eager to show off their skills.
